acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.0019mg/L of Crustacea (Pink shrimp) (ECETOC TR 91, and 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 according to rat LD50 = 800mg/kg (JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975) of Priority 1 document).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on 0.9mg/kg/4H which is the lower value among the rat LC50 = 0.9 and 1.65mg/kg/4H of JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975) in Priority 1 document.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The vapor pressure of this product is very low (it is 0.0000031Pa at 20degC), and it was considered to be difficult to carry out vapor exposure, it was out of a classification.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 = 31.1mg/kg obtained by statistically processing 8 data in JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975) in the Priority 1 document, the substance was classified as Category 2.

carcinogenicity.rationale: In the long-term feed-mix administration test of mice by JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975), and of rats by PDS (WHO/FAO, 1979), the carcinogenic resulting from the this product was not acknowledged. Therefore, it was carried out the outside of category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=6.31 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In the dominant fatality test of the mouse of JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975), it was negative, and it is classified as the out of the Category.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: HSDB (2003) has a description that "it is stabilized at normal temperature", and it was thought that there was no spontaneous combustibility. Thus, it was defined as "out of Category".

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In three-generation studies in rats of JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975) of Priority 1 document, the survival rate of baby animals was significantly decreased at the dose (60ppm) which any specific toxicity was not observed in parent animals. So it was set as Category 1B.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the test of the rabbit, the eye irritations condition had disappeared in 72 hours after-exposure PDS (WHO/FAO, 1979). So it was set as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the test of the rabbit of JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975), since it did not indicate skin stimulative to be also drug substances and a tablet, it considered as the outside of Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although erythrocyte (or brain) cholinesterase inhibition was observed in rat repeated oral administration test with different dosing periods (for 90 days and for two years)(JMPR (WHO Pesticide Residues Series 5, 1975) and PDS (WHO/FAO, 1979) in Priority 1 document), since distinct toxic symptom resulting from the this product was not observed, and target organ was not specified either, it could not be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is description that in HSDB (2003) and SITTIG (4th, 2002) of Priority 2 document, this product which is the organophosphorus insecticide has an inhibition of cholinesterase, and it affects the human nervous system, and it was considered as Category 2 (nervous systems).
